meanings.definition: Capable of being thwarted or prevented.
meanings.sent1: The plan to sneak out was foilable by the creaky floorboards.
meanings.sent2: The lock on the door was easily foilable with a simple key.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hide from mom in the closet was a foilable idea.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to cheat in the game was foilable as his friend caught him red-handed.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's powers made him almost foilable to any villain's evil plans.

meanings.definition: Able to be blocked or hindered.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight was foilable by drawing the curtains.
meanings.sent2: The traffic jam was foilable by taking a different route.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to catch the mouse was foilable by a sudden noise.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was foilable when faced with unexpected challenges.
meanings.sent5: The shield was almost foilable against the dragon's fiery breath.

meanings.definition: Susceptible to being defeated or outsmarted.
meanings.sent1: The villain's evil plan was foilable by the hero's quick thinking.
meanings.sent2: The team's strategy was foilable if the opponent knew their playbook.
meanings.sent3: The spy's disguise was foilable when his glasses fell off.
meanings.sent4: Her argument was foilable when her opponent presented solid evidence.
meanings.sent5: The maze was designed to be almost foilable by anyone with a good sense of direction.
